data.title: Cozy pub with friendly servers and good food
data.text: We made this our first and 2nd to last stop on our walking tour of Historic Downtown Kissimmee. Last stop was at Abracadabra's for ice cream. This is a very nice pub to sit and relax and catch up on the current Olympic news. We'll visit again

data.title: Nice atmosphere so so food
data.text: We stopped by here on our way home from a basketball game. ..typical bar food menu...we had burgers and wings...ok food..decent sevien if a bit slow...menu overpriced and disjointed. .gourmet macaroni and wings on the same menu. ..cute decor....did have an odd smell..later walked to see roto rooter going in the side door...

data.title: Good food, bar atmosphere l, no sweet tea
data.text: I normally won't bring kids to a bar atmosphere but the food at hatfield's is very good.  The menu had lots of choices as wells. Surprised most of the staff doesn't know how to make sweet iced tea.  Boil water, add sugar, add Lipton tea bag then stir and remove tea bag before serving over ice.  I'll be back.

data.title: Well...
data.text: Stopped in for a drink at the bar on a Friday around 5pm. Place was empty. We were greeted by an unfriendly bartender. We asked what beer he had on tap & he pointed to them. Told him we prefer Belgium style beer & he gave us a sample of a German beer. The beer was completely flat, warm & tasted like tomato juice. Worst beer we have ever tasted. We left a tip & walked out.

data.title: Stopped in to check it out - seriously smelled of raw sewer.
data.text: We entered to have drinks and appetizers.  Bar tender was pleasant and knowledgeable but we needed to leave after the first Johnnie Walkers because of the stench of sewer.

data.title: nice meal at the end of the day
data.text: visited after a spring training game on a Sunday afternoon. we sat outside as it was a comfortable evening.  very friendly staff had time to stop and talk.  wife had fajitas, I had the bison burger; both were prepared well.

data.title: Okay, but not great
data.text: Ordered the shrimp linguine pesto. Some shrimp had tails. "Garlic" bread was upside down slider buns, barely toasted. Pretty tacky. No side or salad included with the meal. Tasted ok. Husband had burger which was good. Servers were very helpful and attentive. A little over priced.

data.title: Awesome!!
data.text:
App- guac & chips. Yummy
Ckn soup- wow it was awesome!!
Bison burger& ff - meat & cheese soooo good , bun too big and dry
FF- really good!!

data.title: Great menu and family friendly
data.text: Looks can be deceiving!  Although it appears to be a bar (left side) it is very family friendly. There is no kids menu but no need because there are fantastic sliders on the menu.

data.title: Say no to the Burrito
data.text: Went there for a business lunch. Atmosphere was good, service was very good I unfortunately chose the burrito.  The main ingredient should be the protein not the carbohydrate (rice). In fact I have never had a burrito with rice in it it is most often a side dish. This dish was also served must less than warm in fact could best be described as cold.  My business partner had a salad that he thought was very good. I would try again just not the selection I made today.

data.title: Great new bar in Kissimmee
data.text: Stopped in yesterday while walking around old downtown Kissimmee, while there is not much to see there this is a great new addition. They had $5 Martini and margarita specials which were fantastic. Service was friendly and very knowledgeable about drinks and made sure we were satisfied. The guacamole was fresh and tasted great. Big selection of alcohol, beer and food.

data.title: Not overly impressed
data.text: Happened upon this restaurant by chance during the Art Fair. There were only 3 or 4 tables filled. Service was slow. People arriving after us received food first. Food was brought out staggered. My friend received her meal about 10 min. after I did. The dressing on the salad I ordered was bland. The Mac and Cheese was pretty good and the Sweet potato fries were not too bad. Unfortunately though, the slow service and sad salad hindered the experience. Not too sure I would go back. The bar section and huge tv would probably make this a great venue to meet up and watch some sports though.

data.title: Great Place for a Meal in Old Kissimmee
data.text: We stumbled upon Hatfield's Bar and Grill one weekday afternoon while wandering around Old Kissimmee.  We were looking for a place to have a drink and some appetizers.  We weren't disappointed.  It was raining when we stopped and we sat under the roof of their outdoor courtyard.  The waitress was friendly and helpful and we soon had some drinks and appetizers ordered.  One of the interesting aspects of Hatfield's is that it isn't a chain and it has an eclectic and funky décor. From statues of the Blues Brothers in the outside courtyard to the huge screaming head in the bar, it is quite unique.  Lots of interesting wood and trim make the décor very interesting.  The menu tends to burgers and fajitas and things like that.  We had chicken wings, fajitas, fried calamari and a burger and everyone was impressed by the fare.  To go with that we had beer and wine from a selection that was more than adequate.  If you happen to be wandering around Old Kissimmee and are in need of refreshments give Hatfield's a try.  I don't think you will be disappointed.

data.title: Third visit
data.text:
The staff are awesome, as is the service. The food is good ..drinks are good...but...with cooler weather they chose to have open doors to the kitchen and bar area.. Flies were plentiful :( 
Magnetic screen doors would have helped.

data.title: Change the Music@
data.text: The food was very tasty. .the meats are chargrilled with spices and garlic. The drinks ( Sangria and Passionfruit martini) were wonderful. We sat outside on a cool Friday night...hit happy hour (until 10pm). Skirt steak plate was demolished by my husband so apparently very good. The Hatfield Salad was huge with a light dressing...gtilled chicken on top was perfect.  Only complaint? The music...acid-punk rock is not the choice for the customers you had...look around...we're all over-40. For ambiance,  give us some soft Meican guitar or jazz or country or...ANYTHING but punk acid rock!!!

data.title: Nice new sports bar in downtown
data.text: This place has been a lot time coming and now that it is finally open it is worth it. It has a pretty typical non-chain sports bar feel to it with lots of big screens, a good selection of beer and other drinks, and a nice menu. The wait staff are very friendly although our server was new and while keen to please wasn't up to speed. I would think that will only get better as they mature. This is a very nice addition to downtown and it is good to see an old building (I think it was an original local bank) being put to such good use. We'll be back.

data.title: Good food ..friendly service!
data.text:
Reasonably priced and the food was good.
Fun atmosphere..and tasty drinks!
Located downtown in historic Kissimmee.

data.title: Good Food pleasant staff
data.text: Stopped for lunch, staff was nice, good variety in the menu, had a cheese burger cooked to order, had them put the special sauce on the side, glad I did.  I am sure if you like spicy you would like I just can't do spicy.  Sweet potato fries were very good as well.  Definitely will go back.

data.title: Nice place to hang with friends
data.text: This is a very nice local sports bar with 20 Tv's . very pretty and well spoken waitresses to handle your service indoors or Outdoors    . The food is pretty good too .. Only slight down drinks are a little pricey . But overall nice place to go in Historic Downtown Kissimmee Florida..

data.title: Food ok, service - well....
data.text:
We have been there twice now for lunch, and both times the experience was the same... Fajitas, not very good. Fries, ok - tasty but soggy. Bison burger - decent, not gamey. Service - horrendous!
If you got a good hour for lunch, you could try here - but its certainly not overwhelming. If you got just 30 minutes, you will not be done in time.
Its a good location, with a good atmosphere - but the management needs to figure out how to hire and or train. Cause 40 minutes for bison burgers - and one refill of the sodas - wow... we won't be back.
